page.title: 13HOUSING :FENNY COMPTON.
page.content: Houses range from the very old to the very new;all are well kept,of neat & pleasant appearance,& comfortably furnished.All have hot & cold Water, bathrooms,inside toilets,many are centrally heated,most are carefully insulated.The average house three bed- rooms,kitchen,lounge, dining room,two toilets,& a garden;almost all have fridges,deep freezers & electric cookers.Heating is either by oil,coal or bottled gas. A few houses have thatched roofs,& many old farm build- ings have been skilfully made into houses while still keeping their rural charm.Access is by tarmac road & then concrete paths ; 25% have their own garages, though 80% of houses have cars. The{RED HOUSE }is a large Georgian dwelling by the School, and was at one time the village Rectory. The{MANOR} & {THE GRANGE}are notable.
